thread.title: Sleeping Bear Dunes to host first-ever winter stargazing party

author: Detroit Free Press
title: Sleeping Bear Dunes to host first-ever winter stargazing party

locations.name: sleeping bear dunes national lakeshore park

text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Sleeping Bear Dunes to host first-ever winter stargazing party Brian Manzullo , Detroit Free Press 1:27 p.m. ET Feb. 14, 2017 CLOSE x Share Northern Michigan lake shore recognized by National Geographic as one of the 21 best beaches on Earth. Detroit Free Press Buy Photo The sun sets on a beach at the end of county road 669 in the Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore Park in Michigan in 2011. (Photo: MANDI WRIGHT, Detroit Free Press) Buy Photo 173 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore is trying something new with an old favorite activity this month. 
Though the popular Michigan landmark is a frequent destination for stargazing parties, for the first time, Sleeping Bear Dunes will host a "winter star party" from 7-9 p.m. Feb. 25 (a Saturday) in the Dune Climb parking lot. 
Of course, the event is subject to cancellation if there are cloudy and/or precipitous weather conditions, a decision that would be made two hours in advance of the event. 
Read more: Residents Up North oppose Sleeping Bear Heritage Trail 
"Explore the Milky Way, Mars, and Venus with park rangers and astronomers from the Grand Traverse Astronomical Society," the Facebook event page reads . "Experience the winter night sky in near total darkness. Visitors are asked to park in the row farthest from the dunes, away from the telescopes, with headlights facing M-109." 
For information, call (231) 326-4700. 
Contact Brian Manzullo: bmanzullo@freepress.com. Follow him on Twitter @BrianManzullo . 
Be sure that you follow the Detroit Free Press on Twitter ( @freep ) and Instagram and like us on on Facebook . 173 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE
